0.user_question: Jame will turn 27 in 5 years.  In 8 years his cousin will be 5 years younger than twice his age.  How many years separate the age of the two now?

direct_answer.text: Firstly, let’s find Jame’s current age which would be “current year minus (year when James turns 27 – 5)”. This means Jame currently turned 22 last year since 27 - 5 = 22 years old this year. Given it was stated already we know his cousin’s future relationship so if we multiply double their ages plus one extra compared in time difference using equation c(t)=2j(t)-5=cousinsAge/ j(t)=JamesCurrentAges+timeframeInYears . When you plug into those equations what you get  8*(2*22)+(-5). That equals out as being equal to eighteen seven years apart. You can verify your solution here https://www.calculatorsoup.com/. Given it was stated already we know his cousin’s future relationship so if we multiply double their ages plus one extra compared in time difference using equation c(t)=2j(t)-5=cousinsAge/ j(t)=JamesCurrentAges+timeframeInYears . When you plug into those equations what you get  8*(2*22)+(-5). That equals out as being equal to eighteen seven years apart. You can verify your solution here https://www.calculatorsoup.com/. I hope my explanation helped! Your effort definitely paid off; thank you very much!! 0.user_question: Given a list of conditions, please answer the question. Condition 1:  James turns 27 in 5 years; currently aged X (where X = 27 - 5). Condition 2: His cousin’s age Y in eight years equals half doubled version minus 5 ((Y + 8) = 2 * (X + 8)/2 - 5); therefore we substitute condition one here as well so it becomes Y+8=((27)+(5*2))/2−5 which further simplifies downto Y+8=(39/2)or approximately 19.5 − 5 or roughly 14.5 . Consequently, subtracted back our initial substitution gives us current ages difference D such that D≈ Y−X wherein using above results yields approximate value of ~6 years separating both individuals presently.. Therefore Answer~6!

direct_answer.text: Step by step explanation: Let's start off with finding out Jame's age first. Given that Jame will turn 27 in 5 years, his current age (which we shall denote 'x') is calculated by subtracting those 5 years from 27. This results in x = 27 - 5; meaning x = 22. Hence, right now, Jame is 22 years old. Next, you mentioned something about his cousin being 5 years less than doubled Jame's age in eight years time frame. That translates mathematically to expression ((x + 8)*2)-5 representing Uncle Jim's hypothesized future age relative to Jame. Plugging Jame's actual figure computed previously ('22'), your hypothesis transpires further simplification((22 + 8)*2–5); equating exactly up to twenty points difference.
